> Maybe you have an environment that allows your
> generated code to be compiled and then loaded in without stopping your
> runtime environment.  Is that the case?  If so, what environment are
> you using?

No, I don't use this code for the evolving process - but if I ever 
evolved a solution that I wanted to deploy with a stand alone program, 
I'd rather generate the code and deploy that than deploy the entire NEAT 
environment.

1. The precompiled code would be (slightly) faster.
2. The complexity of the deployed code would be reduced.

Mostly I just wrote it to test that it could be done.

Oh, I use Delphi for DelphiNEAT - Delphi is an object pascal environment.

cheers,
m
